{{pp-protect|small=yes}} {{Use American English|date=July 2018}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2015}} [[File:ColleenBallinger2012.jpg|right|thumb|Ballinger in 2012]] <!-- PLEASE do not include an infobox, per the Talk page. --> '''Colleen Ballinger''' (born November 21, 1986) is an American comedian, actress, singer and [[YouTube]] personality.<ref name=Spangler2016/><!-- Ballinger's DIVORCE announcement is mentioned below; please do not mention it in the Lead section. --> <!-- Please do not add Ballinger's middle name, "Mae", unless you can cite a published, reliable source. --> She is best known for her Internet character [[Miranda Sings]], posting videos of the character on YouTube and performing her one-woman comedy act on tour in theatres worldwide. She created the comically talentless, egotistical and eccentric character to satirize the many YouTube videos featuring people singing badly, but who appear unaware of their lack of talent. In her videos and stage act, the narcissistic character sings and dances badly, discusses current events that she misunderstands, gives inept "tutorials", collaborates with other YouTubers, and rants about her personal issues and her critics, whom she calls the "haters".
Ballinger also features comedy and lifestyle videos on her personal YouTube channel and a vlog channel, Colleen Vlogs. Her YouTube channels, combined, have surpassed 3 billion total views. The Miranda Sings channel has more than 9 million subscribers, and the character has more than 6 million Instagram followers. Ballinger won a [[2015 Teen Choice Awards#Choice Web|Teen Choice Award]] for "Web Star: Comedy"<ref name=Harwood>Harwood, Erika. [http://www.mtv.com/news/2242360/teen-choice-awards-2015-winners-list "Teen Choice Awards 2015: See The Full Winners List"], MTV.com, August 16, 2015</ref> and a [[Streamy Awards|Streamy Award]] as Best Actress.<ref name=FullList/> ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' selected her as one of its Top 25 Digital Stars.<ref name=Jarvey1/>
Ballinger has appeared as an actress and singer [[Off-Broadway]], in regional theatre, on television and in web series, and has sung as a guest artist on albums. In 2014, she guest-starred as Miranda Sings on ''[[Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee]]'' with [[Jerry Seinfeld]] and appeared as Miranda on ''[[The Tonight Show]]''. In 2015, Ballinger was a guest co-host on ''[[The View (U.S. TV series)|The View]]'', appeared as Miranda on ''[[The Grace Helbig Show]]'' and released a best-selling book, written in Miranda's voice, ''[[Selp Helf]]''.<ref name=PublishersWeekly/> Ballinger conceived, produced, wrote for and starred as Miranda in the [[Netflix]] series, ''[[Haters Back Off]]'', which explored Miranda's origins and family life; the series ran for two seasons, 2016 and 2017. In 2018, she appeared in season 3 of ''[[Escape the Night]]''. She has toured as Miranda in live comedy shows since the character became popular in 2009.
==Life and career== [[File:Trent, Rachel, Colleen and Chris Ballinger.jpg|thumb|right|All four Ballinger siblings, from left: Trent, Rachel, Colleen and Chris, in 2015]]
===Early life; acting career=== Ballinger was born and raised in [[Santa Barbara, California|Santa Barbara]], California, the daughter of Tim Ballinger, a sales manager, and his wife Gwen, a homemaker.<ref name=RhettandLink>[[Rhett and Link|McLaughlin, Rhett James and Charles Lincoln Neal III]]. [https://soundcloud.com/earbiscuits/ep-25-colleen-ballinger "Ep. 25 Colleen Ballinger (Miranda Sings)"], at 23:40, 25:00, 26:20 and 31:52, ''Ear Biscuits'', Soundcloud.com, March 31, 2014</ref> Ballinger attended [[San Marcos High School (Santa Barbara, California)|San Marcos High School]]<ref>[https://www.edhat.com/site/tidbit.cfm?nid=171442 "San Marcos Grad a YouTube Sensation"], ''Edhat'' Santa Barbara, June 25, 2016</ref> and graduated in 2008 from [[Azusa Pacific University]], where she majored in vocal performance.<ref name="Lobero"/><ref name=Briscoe>Briscoe, Jake. [https://gazettereview.com/2017/10/colleen-ballinger-snapchat-name-snapchat-username-snapcode "Colleen Ballinger Snapchat Name â€“ What is Her Snapchat Username & Snapcode?"], ''Gazette Review'', October 7, 2017</ref> She has two older brothers, Christopher and Trent, and a younger sister, Rachel.<ref name=RhettandLink/><ref name=Emertainment>Hohenstein, Serena. [http://emertainmentmonthly.com/2014/03/08/channel-spotlight-colleen-ballinger "Channel Spotlight: Colleen Ballinger"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006082530/http://emertainmentmonthly.com/2014/03/08/channel-spotlight-colleen-ballinger/ |date=October 6, 2014 }}, ''Emertainment Monthly'', [[Emerson College]], March 8, 2014, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> Christopher and Rachel maintain YouTube channels with more than two million and one million subscribers, respectively.<ref>Ballinger Rachel. [https://www.youtube.com/user/NOVAQUA "Rachel Ballinger"], YouTube, accessed August 2, 2018</ref><ref>Ballinger, Christopher. [https://www.youtube.com/user/BallingersPresent "Ballinger Family"], accessed August 2, 2018</ref>
From 2007 to 2009, Ballinger performed for [[Disney]] in California, gave private voice, movement coaching and piano lessons to children, and performed at parties and cabaret spaces.<ref name=Spangler2016>Spangler, Todd. [https://variety.com/2016/digital/news/miranda-sings-colleen-ballinger-youtube-netflix-1201799533 "Miranda Sings Leads the Way for Digital Stars Leaping to TV"], ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'', June 21, 2016</ref><ref>[http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/STAGE_TUBE_Miranda_Sings_Visits_Clevver_TV_20091104 "Miranda Sings Visits Clevver TV"], BroadwayWorld, November 4, 2009, accessed October 4, 2014; Velasco, Schuyler. [http://www.backstage.com/interview/miranda-sings "Interview: Miranda Sings"], ''[[Backstage (magazine)|Backstage]]'', August 3, 2010, accessed October 4, 2014; and Seabaugh, Julie. [http://www.laweekly.com/arts/the-woman-behind-miranda-one-of-the-strangest-and-most-beloved-characters-on-youtube-5827099 "The Woman Behind Miranda, One of the Strangest and Most Beloved Characters on YouTube"]. ''[[LA Weekly]]'', July 23, 2015</ref> In 2009, she played Kelsi Nielsen in ''[[High School Musical on Stage!|High School Musical]]'' at Candlelight Pavilion Dinner Theatre in [[Claremont, California|Claremont]], California.<ref name=Briscoe/><ref>[http://www.inlandtheatre.org/2009/05/07/disneys-high-school-musical-at-candlelight-pavilion "Disneyâ€™s High School Musical at Candlelight Pavilion"], Inland Theatre League, May 7, 2009, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> Ballinger appears on the 2010 album ''More With Every Line'', by songwriter Tim Prottey-Jones,<ref>Gould, Robert. [http://westend.broadwayworld.com/article/MORE_WITH_EVERY_LINE_THE_MUSIC_OF_TIM_PROTTEYJONES_An_Album_Of_New_Musical_Theatre_Songs_With_An_Allstar_Cast_Set_For_Late_2010_Release_20100929 "''More With Every Line'' â€“ The Music of Tim Prottey-Jones"], BroadwayWorld.com, September 29, 2010, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> and the 2011 album ''Self Taught, Still Learning'' by Chris Passey.<ref name=Browne>[http://pollybrowne.wordpress.com/2011/11/15/self-taught-still-learning-chris-passey-album-review "''Self Taught, Still Learning'' â€“ Chris Passey (Album Review)"], Polly Browne's Blog, November 15, 2011, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> She played [[Lynda Bird Johnson Robb|Lynda Bird Johnson]] in a staged reading of ''First Kids'' in New York in June 2011, and in October 2011 she created the role of [[Circe]] in the American Theatre of Actors [[Off-Broadway]] production ''Odyssey â€“ The Epic Musical''.<ref>[http://www.abouttheartists.com/artists/380846 "Colleen Ballinger"], About the Artists, accessed October 4, 2014</ref>
In 2012, Ballinger was featured as nurse Royal in the web series ''Dr. Fubalous''.<ref>[https://www.facebook.com/drfubalous/info ''Dr. Fubalous''], Facebook, accessed October 4, 2014; and [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2117148/epcast ''Dr. Fubalous''], Internet Movie Database, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> She also gave a talk at the Boston Children's Theatre about how to use social media to promote yourself as a performer.<ref>Jarvedon. [http://bostonchildrenstheatre.org/youtube-sensation-miranda-sings-visits-bct "YouTube Sensation Miranda Sings Visits BCT!"], BostonChildrensTheatre.org, July 20, 2012</ref><ref>Shanahan, Mark and Meredith Goldstein. [https://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/names/2012/07/10/youtube-sensation-miranda-sings-talk-boston-children-theatre/uCiScwZ9WZZnaSSFDrIyaN/story.html "Woman behind Miranda Sings a real character"], ''[[The Boston Globe]]'', July 11, 2012</ref> In 2013, she starred in the episode "Under the Bed" in the web series ''The Flipside''<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6cqHbF-3qE "Under the Bed â€“ The FlipSide"], YouTube, February 27, 2013, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> and as Amara in episode 9 of season 2 of the web series ''[[Hipsterhood]]''.<ref>O'Neill, Emma. [http://www.leakynews.com/hipsterhood-season-two-has-arrived-67937 "''Hipsterhood'' Season Two Has Arrived"], ''Geeky News'', September 1, 2013, accessed October 4, 2014; and [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tXLyviJpP3M "'Hipster Mecca: The Silverlake Farmer's Market' â€“ S2:E9"], Hipsterhood, YouTube, October 22, 2013, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> She plays Meg on the Volume 12 DVD of ''[[Family Guy]]'' in the live-action version of the show's introduction.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Ry4zRtaygo "Family Guy Live Action Intro Homemade for Volume 12 DVD"], CineFix, December 10, 2013, November 30, 2014</ref> Also in 2013, she was featured on the MTV ''[[True Life]]'' episode "I'm Famous Online".<ref>[http://www.mtv.com/videos/misc/985507/true-life-im-famous-online.jhtml#series=2214&seriesId=5232&channelId=1&id=1718628 "True Life: I'm Famous Online"], [[MTV]], December 6, 2013, accessed October 4, 2014</ref> In 2014, she appeared in the episode "Wedding Plans!" on the web series ''[[MyMusic]]''.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ONh4uPjXo3Q "Wedding Plans! (MyMusic Season 2 Episode 23)"], TheFineBros, YouTube, January 21, 2014, accessed October 4, 2014</ref>
Ballinger was a guest co-host on ''[[The View (U.S. TV series)|The View]]'' in January 2015.<ref name=View>[http://emptylighthouse.com/colleen-ballinger-takes-over-view-dished-creation-miranda-sings-526856403 "Colleen Ballinger Takes Over ''The View'', Dishes on Creation of Miranda Sings"], ''Empty Lighthouse Magazine'', January 22, 2015; Brouwer, Bree. [http://www.tubefilter.com/2015/01/23/colleen-ballinger-abc-the-view-appearance "YouTube Star Colleen Ballinger (AKA Miranda Sings) Guest Hosts ABCâ€™s â€˜'The Viewâ€™'"], YouTubeFilter.com, January 23, 2015</ref> In February 2015, she was interviewed on the podcast ''[[RuPaul]]: What's the Tee?'' with [[Michelle Visage]].<ref>[http://www.rupaulpodcast.com/episodes/2015/2/25/episode-24-anti-porn-unicorn-with-colleen-ballinger-and-miranda-sings "Episode 24: Anti-Porn Unicorn"], ''RuPaul: What's the Tee?'', February 25, 2015</ref> In May, she starred in a [[Todrick Hall]] video, "Beauty and the Beat Boots".<ref>Tousignant, Lauren. [https://nypost.com/2015/05/07/beauty-and-the-beast-lgbt-parody-calls-belle-basic "''Beauty and the Beast'' LGBT Parody Calls Belle 'Basic'"], ''[[New York Post]]'', May 7, 2015</ref> and appeared in the Season 2 finale of the [[Conde Nast Entertainment|CondÃ© Nast Entertainment]] webseries ''#HeyUSA'', with host [[Mamrie Hart]].<ref>Spangler, Todd. [https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/youtube-star-mamrie-hart-hits-road-again-in-heyusa-travel-show-for-conde-nast-1201457092 "YouTube Star Mamrie Hart Hits Road Again in ''HeyUSA'' Travel Show for CondÃ© Nast"], ''Variety'', March 20, 2015; Hart, Mamrie. [https://thescene.com/watch/presents/heyusa-mamrie-colleen-ballinger-san-francisco-part-1 "Mamrie + Colleen Ballinger: San Francisco Part 1"], ''HeyUSA'', TheScene.com, May 7, 2015; and Hart, Mamrie. [https://thescene.com/watch/presents/heyusa-mamrie-colleen-ballinger-san-francisco-part-2 "Mamrie + Colleen Ballinger: San Francisco Part 2"], ''HeyUSA'', TheScene.com, May 10, 2015</ref> In June and July, both as herself and as Miranda, Ballinger starred in a six-episode beauty series parody, called ''How to Makeup'', on the I Love Makeup YouTube channel operated by [[Collective Digital Studio]]. In this show, "Colleen has fantastically found a way for guys to become interested in a makeup show that isnâ€™t called 'Naked Ladies Wear Makeup While Kissing Each Other and Boobies and Stuff' ... thereâ€™s a plot to this makeup show".<ref>Klima, Jeff. [http://newmediarockstars.com/2015/06/team-colleen-or-team-miranda-colleen-ballinger-squares-off-against-miranda-sings-for-new-makeup-show "Team Colleen or Team Miranda? Colleen Ballinger Squares Off Against Miranda Sings for New Makeup Show"], ''New Media Rockstars'', June 18, 2015</ref><ref>Patel, Sahil. [http://www.thevideoink.com/news/cds-colleen-ballinger-aka-miranda-sings-debut-new-makeup-series/#.VYLf_4xN-zk "CDS and Colleen Ballinger (and Miranda Sings) Debut New Makeup Series"], TheVideoInk.com, June 18, 2015</ref> In July 2015, [[Re/code]] featured Ballinger to exemplify "an emerging economy" of internet content providers.<ref>Kurzweil, Ethan and Cecilia Stallsmith. [http://recode.net/2015/07/22/fames-dose-of-democratization "Fameâ€™s Dose of Democratization"], [[Re/code]], July 22, 2015</ref> She is featured on the track "Clouds" in [[Flula Borg]]'s 2015 EP, ''I Want to Touch You''.<ref>Bork, Flula. [https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/i-want-to-touch-you-ep/id1040559274 ''I Want to Touch You''], iTunes, accessed September 28, 2015</ref>
Ballinger appeared in a series of 2016 [[DiGiorno]] pizza commercials.<ref>Shields, Mike. [https://www.wsj.com/articles/digiorno-taps-youtube-talent-for-tv-ad-campaign-leading-up-to-the-super-bowl-1453978800 "DiGiorno Taps YouTube Talent for TV Ad Campaign Leading Up to the Super Bowl"], ''Wall Street Journal'', January 28, 2016</ref> She appeared as "The Disco Dancer" in season 3 of the web series ''[[Escape the Night]]'', released in June and July 2018.<ref name=Escape1>Gutelle, Sam. [https://www.tubefilter.com/2018/06/21/escape-the-night-season-three-youtube-premium "Season Three of Joey Graceffaâ€™s ''Escape The Night'' Now Available Via YouTube Premium"], Tubefilter.com, June 21, 2018; and Hoggatt, Aja. [http://ew.com/tv/2018/05/31/escape-the-night-final-cast-announcement "Colleen Ballinger among final cast revealed for Escape the Night season 3"], ''Entertainment Weekly'', May 31, 2018</ref>
===Comedy act and online success=== [[File:ColleenBallinger2014.png|left|thumb|upright|Ballinger opening her act as herself, in 2014, before changing into Miranda.<ref name=Sherwin/>]] In 2009, Ballinger began to make a living by performing her live one-woman comedy act in character as Miranda Sings.<ref name=Talks/><ref name=Liberty/><ref>[http://broadwayworld.com/article/Photo-Flash-Miranda-Sings-Joshua-Ledet-More-Visit-Birdland-20120529# "Photo Flash: Miranda Sings, Joshua Ledet, & More Visit Birdland!"], BroadwayWorld.com, May 29, 2012</ref> She has continued to tour since then and has stated that, of all her professional activities, she gets the most satisfaction from her live performances.<ref name=Videoink>Klein, Jessica. [http://www.thevideoink.com/features/youtuber-colleen-ballinger-loves-performing-live-even/#.U0GG9xMVC8A "YouTuber Colleen Ballinger Loves Performing Live Even More"], Thevideoink.com, April 1, 2014</ref><ref>[[Rhett and Link|McLaughlin, Rhett james and Charles Lincoln Neal III]]. [https://soundcloud.com/earbiscuits/ep-25-colleen-ballinger "Ep. 25 Colleen Ballinger (Miranda Sings)"], Interview of Ballinger at 46:10 and 50:00, ''Ear Biscuits'', Soundcloud.com, March 31, 2014</ref> In addition to her Miranda tours, Ballinger toured with her then husband, singer and fellow YouTuber Joshua David Evans in music and comedy shows in December 2015<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/ci_29265025/calendar "Calendar"], ''San Jose Mercury News'', December 16, 2015</ref> and January 2016 across the US as "The Colleen & Josh Show".<ref name=JoshleenTour1>[http://staugustine.com/compass/2016-01-14#.Vpgw_1nU1PZ "The Colleen & Josh Show brings music, laughs"], ''[[The St. Augustine Record]]'', January 14, 2016; [http://sandiegotheatres.org/the-colleen-and-josh-show "The Colleen and Josh Show"], San Diego Theatres, accessed January 9, 2016; [http://www.statesman.com/news/entertainment/more-events-for-wednesday-jan-13-and-beyond/np3BD "More events for Wednesday, Jan. 13, and beyond"], [[Austin American-Statesman|Statesman.com]], January 12, 2016; and Ballinger, Colleen. [https://www.instagram.com/p/--CZx9MGbe "We're Going On Tour!"], Instagram, December 6, 2015</ref>
Ballinger displays more than 1,000 videos on her YouTube channels.<ref name=Channels>Ballinger, Colleen. [https://www.youtube.com/user/mirandasings08/about "Miranda Sings: About"], YouTube; [https://www.youtube.com/user/PsychoSoprano/about "Colleen Ballinger: About"], YouTube; and [https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrbSjN1_5U7hqFKRA0nvFXQ/about "Colleen Vlogs: About"], YouTube, all accessed July 16, 2018</ref> Her personal channel features comedy, question and answer videos, YouTube challenges, and Ballinger discussing culture and current topics or vlogging her activities with her family, friends and YouTube colleagues.<ref name=CCRI>[https://www.ccri.edu/marketing/news_events/2013/march/miranda.html "Comedian Colleen Ballinger bringing hit Internet character Miranda Sings to CCRI"], Community College of Rhode Island, March 14, 2013, accessed February 14, 2016</ref><ref>Ballinger, Colleen. [https://www.youtube.com/user/PsychoSoprano/about "Colleen Ballinger: About"], YouTube, accessed November 5, 2014</ref> The channel is "highly recommended" by ''Emertainment Monthly''.<ref name=Emertainment/> It has received more than 1.1 billion views and accumulated more than 6 million subscribers. Her Miranda Sings channel has surpassed 1.7 billion views and 9 million subscribers. A third channel, Colleen Vlogs, with more than 1.8 million subscribers, chronicles some of her experiences on tour and at home.<ref name=Channels/> In 2014, ''[[Backstage (magazine)|Backstage]]'' magazine identified Ballinger as a performer who has "taken great advantage of producing their own content [online] and gathering large fan bases to promote their work."<ref>Ross, Mae. [http://www.backstage.com/advice-for-actors/backstage-experts/4-things-keep-mind-when-creating-your-own-content "4 Things to Keep in Mind When Creating Your Own Content"], ''Backstage'' magazine, October 3, 2014</ref> To promote her videos and shows, Ballinger is active on social media, with Instagram followings of more than 6 million for Miranda and 4 million for Ballinger, Twitter followings of more than 2.6 million for Miranda and 1.5 million for Ballinger, and more than 1.7 million page likes on the Miranda Sings Facebook page.<ref name=SocialMedia>[http://instagram.com/MirandaSingsofficial "MirandaSingsOfficial"], Instagram; [https://www.instagram.com/colleen/?hl=en Colleen], Instagram; [https://twitter.com/MirandaSings "Miranda Sings"], Twitter.com; [https://twitter.com/colleenb123 Colleen], Twitter.com; and [https://www.facebook.com/MirandaSingsOfficial "Miranda Sings"], Facebook; all accessed February 15, 2018</ref> [[BuzzFeed]] called Miranda "The Queen of Twitter".<ref>Wingfield, Katie. [https://www.buzzfeed.com/katiewingfield/19-reasons-miranda-sings-is-the-queen-of-twitter-w7l6#.dn0oQkPpM "19 Reasons Miranda Sings Is the Queen of Twitter"], BuzzFeed, September 18, 2014</ref>
Ballinger was able to turn the popularity of her videos into income from a percentage of advertising fees<ref name="Videoink"/><ref name=WSJ1>Keates, Nancy. [https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702304537904577279663808279888 "Just a Spoonful of Cinnamon Makes the Internet Rounds"], ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'', March 14, 2012</ref> or occasionally fixed sponsorship fees.<ref>Maheshwariaug, Sapna. [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/30/business/media/instagram-ads-marketing-kardashian.html?_r=0 "Endorsed on Instagram by a Kardashian, but Is It Love or Just an Ad?"], ''The New York Times'', August 30, 2016</ref> She told the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'': "I have to do things like torture myself to keep people watching" her YouTube videos.<ref name=WSJ1/> To this end, she made a popular [[cinnamon challenge]] video in character as Miranda,<ref name=WSJ1/><ref>Ballinger, Colleen. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tVjJ8rqFA_8 "Cinnamon Challenge (Miranda Sings)"], YouTube, February 20, 2012, accessed January 13, 2015</ref> Until March 2013, Ballinger' YouTube audience was modest, but in that month, her Miranda Sings channel's audience reached 150,000 subscribers,<ref>Ballinger, Colleen. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6uyP_lpwPk "Present for My Fans!!! 150,000 subscribers"], YouTube, March 8, 2013</ref> and both of her YouTube channels began to expand far more rapidly.<ref name=Briscoe/><ref>Urgo, Jason. [http://socialblade.com/youtube/user/mirandasings08 "Miranda Sings: YouTube Progress Graphs"] and [http://socialblade.com/youtube/user/psychosoprano "Colleen Ballinger: YouTube Progress Graphs"], Social Blade, accessed January 29, 2018</ref> Ballinger offers merchandise on her mirandasings.com website, and some of the videos contain brand endorsements.<ref name=Nightline2015/><ref name=GLV/> For example, a 2016 video, "Sexy Buttery Love Song" promoted [[Jack in the Box]] restaurants.<ref>Best, Katelyn. [http://splitsider.com/2016/03/where-brands-and-comedy-meet-the-weird-world-of-native-marketing "Where Brands and Comedy Meet: The Weird World of 'Native Marketing'"], Splitsider.com, March 7, 2016</ref> In 2016, ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine ranked Ballinger as the ninth highest-earning YouTuber.<ref>Berg, Madeline. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2016/12/05/the-highest-paid-youtube-stars-2016-pewdiepie-remains-no-1-with-15-million/#6c89bc286b0f "The Highest-Paid YouTube Stars 2016: PewDiePie Remains No. 1 With $15 Million"], ''Forbes'' magazine, December 5, 2016</ref>
===Personal life=== Ballinger moved to New York City in 2010 to follow performing opportunities, but she returned to the West coast in 2012 when she realized that, to maximize her YouTube audience, she needed to collaborate with the community of YouTubers based in Los Angeles.<ref name=Briscoe/> In July 2015, after several years of dating,<ref name=Nightline2015>Wright, David, Brandon Baur and Alexa Valiente. [http://abcnews.go.com/Lifestyle/life-youre-engaged-youtube-star/story?id=28178384 "What Life Is Like When Youâ€™re Engaged to a YouTube Star"], ABC News, January 12, 2015; Wright, David. [http://abcnews.go.com/Nightline/video/youtube-stars-fall-love-28184605 "When YouTube Stars Fall in Love"], ''Nightline'', January 13, 2015</ref> Ballinger and Joshua Evans wed in California.<ref>Gavilanes, Grace. [http://www.people.com/article/miranda-sings-married-life "VidCon 2015: Miranda Sings Is About to Make the Hardest Newlywed Decision, Like, Ever"], ''People'' magazine, July 23, 2015</ref> In September 2016, the couple announced their divorce.<ref>Miller, Jenni. [http://nymag.com/thecut/2016/10/miranda-sings-posts-wrenching-youtube-video-about-divorce.html "This Video About Getting Divorced Is Almost Too Painful"], ''New York'' magazine, October 2, 2016; Pilcher, Rachel. [http://www.mtv.co.uk/miranda-sings/news/fans-react-to-the-sad-news-that-colleen-ballinger-and-josh-evans-are-divorcing "Fans React to the Sad News that Colleen Ballinger and Joshua Evans Are Divorcing"], MTV, October 1, 2016; and Makalintal, Bettina. [https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2017/04/when-youtube-stars-breakup/521727 "Why Watching People Break Up on YouTube Is So Addictive"], ''The Atlantic'', April 3, 2017</ref>
Ballinger then purchased a new home in [[Encino, California|Encino]], California.<ref>Paul, Arielle. [http://www.latimes.com/business/realestate/hot-property/la-fi-hp-my-favorite-room-colleen-ballinger-20180623-story.html "My Favorite Room: Colleen Ballinger makes room in her office for Miranda and her YouTube fans"], ''Los Angeles Times'', June 23, 2018</ref> Ballinger met actor [[Erik Stocklin]] in 2016 when she cast him to play Miranda's love interest in ''Haters Back Off''. The couple began dating by early 2018 and confirmed the relationship publicly in June 2018.<ref>D'Aluisio, Alexandra. [http://www.clevver.com/colleen-ballinger-erik-stocklin-dating "Colleen Ballinger Confirms She's Dating ''Haters Back Off'' Co-Star Erik Stocklin"], [[Defy Media#Clevver Media|Clevver Media]], June 12, 2018</ref> Later the same month, Ballinger announced that she and Stocklin are engaged and expecting their first child.<ref>Quinn, Dave. [https://people.com/babies/miranda-sings-colleen-ballinger-engaged-pregnant-expecting-first-child "A Proposal and a Pregnancy! Miranda Sings' Colleen Ballinger Reveals She's Engaged and Expecting"], ''People'', June 29, 2018; and LaCroix, Emy. [https://www.lifeandstylemag.com/posts/who-is-colleen-ballinger-dating-162754 "Colleen Ballinger AKA Miranda Sings' Baby Daddy Erik Stocklin Is 'Not an Internet Person' but She Doesn't Mind"], ''[[Life & Style (magazine)|Life & Style]]'', July 3, 2018</ref>
==Miranda Sings== {{Main|Miranda Sings}}
===YouTube videos=== [[File:Miranda Sings by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|right|"Miranda Sings" at [[VidCon]] 2014 in Anaheim, California]] Since January 2008, Ballinger has posted more than 400 videos as her comically talentless and quirky character, Miranda Sings, primarily on the [[YouTube]] channel Miranda Sings.<ref name=Ng>Ng, David. [https://web.archive.org/web/20090515113821/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/culturemonster/2009/05/miranda-sings-colleen-ballinger-jim-caruso-cast-party-jersey-boys-daniel-reichard.html "YouTube sensation Miranda seduces Broadway"], ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', May 11, 2009</ref><ref>[https://www.youtube.com/user/mirandasings08/videos "Miranda Sings: Videos"], YouTube, accessed November 5, 2014</ref> The character is a satire of the many YouTube videos featuring bad, but egotistical, performers who film themselves singing as a form of self-promotion, despite receiving the realistic or cruel comments of "haters".<ref name=times>Eggar, Robin. [http://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_ver=z39.88-2004&rft_id=info:sid/iw.newsbank.com:UKNB:LSTB&rft_val_format=info:ofi/fmt:kev:mtx:ctx&rft_dat=12F76AE6F4E371A8&svc_dat=InfoWeb:aggregated5&req_dat=102CDD40F14C6BDA "She'd like to teach the world to sing"]. ''[[The Times]]'', May 2, 2010, accessed March 6, 2012</ref><ref>[http://transmediatv.blogspot.com/2010/02/meme-comes-to-life.html "Meme Comes to Life"], Transmedia Televisual Studies, FILM345, Queens University, February 2010</ref> "Miranda" is supposedly a home-schooled young woman who still lives with her mother and uncle; she is eccentric and infantilized, narcissistically believes that she was born famous, and is obsessed with show business fame.<ref name=Velasco>Velasco, Schuyler. [http://www.backstage.com/interview/miranda-sings "Interview: Miranda Sings"], ''[[Backstage (magazine)|Backstage]]'', August 3, 2010</ref><ref>Rivera, Erica. [http://www.citypages.com/music/the-haters-defined-youtube-sensation-miranda-sings-7538067 "'The haters' defined YouTube sensation Miranda Sings"], ''[[City Pages]]'', August 4, 2015</ref>
In the videos, Miranda sings in a comically off-key, yet plausible, voice and covers mostly [[pop music]] hits, rants about internet haters, gives "tutorials", and sometimes discusses the character's backstory or current events, which she usually misunderstands.<ref name=GLV/><ref name=Prospector>Sarinana, Leslie. [http://www.theprospectordaily.com/2017/01/17/miranda-sings-is-back-youre-welcome "'Miranda Sings' is back â€¦ youâ€™re welcome"], ''The Prospector'', January 17, 2017</ref> She uses [[spoonerisms]] and [[malapropisms]],<ref name=Keihm>Keihm, Moira. [http://heavy.com/social/2016/01/miranda-sings-netflix-real-name-youtube-book-videos-tour "YouTube Personality Miranda Sings: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know"], [[Heavy.com]], January 17, 2016</ref> is irritable, ludicrously self-absorbed and self-righteous, socially awkward, and has a defiant, arrogant attitude.<ref name="Clevver" /><ref name=Peen/><ref name=Buffalo1>Siegel, Ben. [http://www.buffalonews.com/gusto/comedy/miranda-shows-that-shes-very-good-at-being-bad-20140505 "Miranda shows that sheâ€™s very good at being bad"], ''[[The Buffalo News]]'', May 6, 2014</ref> She responds to viewers who take the videos seriously and offer criticism with the catchphrase, "Haters back off!",<ref name=Keihm/><ref name=TheaterJones1/> telling these critics that "haters make me famous".<ref name=times/><ref>[http://blog.stubdog.com/new-york/miranda-sings-at-birdland.html "Miranda Sings! at Birdland"], stubdog.com, February 4, 2010</ref> The character displays unusually active eyebrows and a crooked smile,<ref name=GLV>Collier, Cody. [http://guardianlv.com/2014/06/youtube-gives-fame-to-miranda-sings "YouTube Gives Fame to Miranda Sings"], ''Guardian Liberty Voice'', Clark County, Nevada, June 29, 2014</ref><ref name=Peen>Wilson, Jessica. [http://whatspeenseen.co.uk/reviews/miranda-sings-review "Miranda Sings â€“ review"], ''What's Peen Seen?'' September 11, 2013, accessed May 5, 2014</ref> her head is cocked to one side, and she has pronunciation quirks.<ref name=Velasco/> She wears bright red lipstick drawn beyond the borders of her lips, dresses in mismatched out-of-style clothing, and often dances stiffly to the music she is performing.<ref name=Liberty>Liberty, John. [http://www.mlive.com/entertainment/kalamazoo/index.ssf/2011/12/youtube_star_miranda_sings_to.html "YouTube star Miranda Sings to make Michigan debut, readies for haters",] ''Kalamazoo Gazette'', Mlive.com, December 1, 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2009/10/04/PKGE19REP8.DTL "Music/Cabaret Miranda Sings"], ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]'', October 4, 2009; Bond, Nick. [http://www.starobserver.com.au/features/entertainment-features/entertainment-play/haters-back-off-mirandas-coming/111839 "Haters back off â€“ Mirandaâ€™s coming"], ''Star Observer'', October 30, 2013</ref> Her views of society and morality are [[politically incorrect]], and she displays a strong aversion to anything risque, which she calls "porn".<ref>[http://www.thegayuk.com/#/magazine/4574334751/THE-GAY-TEST-MIRANDA-SINGS/3256355 "The Gay Test: Miranda Sings"], ''TheGayUK'', August 17, 2012, accessed December 9, 2013</ref><ref>Walgrove, Amanda. [http://whatstrending.com/2013/08/miranda-sings-covers-starships-performs-magic-introduces-mirandacon-vidcon-2013 "Miranda Sings Covers "Starships," Performs Magic and Introduces MirandaCon at VidCon 2013"], WhatsTrending.com, August 5, 2013</ref> From 2010 to 2012, Ballinger posted 86 Miranda video blogs to a second Miranda YouTube channel, Mirandavlogz.<ref name=Vlogz>In these videos, the character gives ineffective tutorials, offers comically ridiculous opinions and participates in "challenges". See Ballinger, Colleen. [https://www.youtube.com/user/Mirandavlogz/videos?view=0 Mirandavlogz], YouTube, accessed November 11, 2014</ref>
Ballinger based the character partly on young women that she knew in college.<ref name=Velasco/> She told ''[[The Times]]'' of London, "There were a lot of cocky girls who thought they were really talented, and they ... were so rude and snotty.... Then I saw all these girls trying to make a career out of putting videos on YouTube [of themselves singing in their bedrooms] ... clueless to the fact that they were terrible."<ref name=Lobero>Ballinger, Colleen. [http://www.lobero.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Miranda-Sings-at-the-Lobero-Press-Release.pdf "Miranda Sings at the Lobero in Santa Barbara"], Lobero.com, January 10, 2014; and Dugger, Brian. [http://www.toledoblade.com/Music-Theater-Dance/2018/07/07/Miranda-Sings-off-key-comically-and-to-legions-of-fans-bsd.html "Miranda Sings off-key, comically, to legions of fans"], ''[[The Blade (Toledo, Ohio)|The Blade]]'', July 7, 2018</ref><ref name=CallMeAdam>Rothenberg, Adam. [http://www.callmeadam.com/interviews/2012/5/23/colleen-ballinger-miranda-sings.html#.U2fjP1cVDl8 "Colleen Ballinger: Miranda Sings!"], ''Call Me Adam'', May 23, 2012, accessed May 5, 2014</ref> At first, the "Miranda videos were meant to be an inside joke" among Ballinger's friends.<ref name=Talks>Sims, James. [http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/Colleen-Ballinger-Talks-YouTube-Character-Miranda-Sings-20100827 "Colleen Ballinger Talks YouTube Character Miranda Sings"], Broadwayworld.com, August 27, 2010, accessed October 30, 2013</ref><ref name = MoreThan>Flair, Justus. [http://www.dailyiowan.com/2014/04/10/Arts/37417.html "More than red lipstick"], ''[[The Daily Iowan]]'', April 10, 2014</ref> In March 2009, however, a Miranda video called "Free Voice Lesson" quickly became a sensation.<ref name=CallMeAdam/><ref>Linton, Shannon. [http://www.apu.edu/articles/18690 "Miranda Sings ... Terribly: An Unlikely Rise to Stardom"], ''APU Life'', Spring '12 issue, May 30, 2012</ref> The video consists of bad advice about singing technique.<ref name=Lobero/><ref name=Velasco/> Miranda's videos drew predictably sharp criticism on YouTube, and as they became popular, Ballinger modified the character in response to the negative comments. She says: "I took what people hated and exaggerated it more in the next video."<ref name=Liberty/><ref>Roberts, Kayleigh. [http://highlandpark.patch.com/articles/americas-got-no-talent "America's Got No Talent"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120315052828/http://highlandpark.patch.com/articles/americas-got-no-talent |date=March 15, 2012 }}. ''Highland Park Patch'', November 18, 2010; Turi, Sean. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r8Lylry7qKE "Sean Turi Features Colleen Ballinger & Miranda Sings"], YouTube, April 1, 2013</ref> The online critics were so harsh that Miranda became a "hero of the anti-bullying movement".<ref name=TheaterJones1>Noteboom, Kris. [http://www.theaterjones.com/outoftheloopfringefestival2012/20120305133815/2012-03-05/BooTube "BooTube"], ''TheaterJones'', March 5, 2012</ref><ref>[https://soundcloud.com/earbiscuits/ep-25-colleen-ballinger "Ep. 25 Colleen Ballinger (Miranda Sings)"], Interview of Ballinger at 54:20 and 58:30, ''Ear Biscuits'', Soundcloud.com, March 31, 2014</ref> Ballinger uses "humour and satire to challenge ideas of popular femininity. ... Miranda Sings ... puts on monstrous makeup to perform parody music videos [rejecting] being conventionally pretty."<ref>[http://theconversation.com/beauty-fashion-and-looking-hot-youtubes-powerful-messages-for-girls-72363 "Beauty, fashion and looking 'hot': YouTubeâ€™s powerful messages for girls"], ''[[The Conversation (website)|The Conversation]]'', May 24, 2017</ref>
Since Ballinger became pregnant in 2018, Miranda has begun a pregnancy storyline in which she claims to be the "virgin Miranda", expecting a virgin birth. Ballinger mentioned the story arc on a July 2018 appearance on ''[[Live with Kelly and Ryan]]''.<ref>Belanger, Jeremy. [https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/colleen-ballinger-aka-miranda-sings-reveals-behind-scenes-details-viral-pregnancy-video-175650919.html "Colleen Ballinger, aka Miranda Sings, reveals behind-the-scenes details of viral pregnancy video"], Yahoo!, July 9, 2018</ref>
===Live comedy act=== Since April 2009,<ref>[http://broadwayworld.com/article/Photo_Flash_Miranda_Sings_at_Birdlands_CAST_PARTY_20090429 "Photo Flash: 'Miranda Sings' at Birdland's ''Cast Party''"], BroadwayWorld.com, April 29, 2009, accessed May 23, 2012</ref> Ballinger has performed a one-woman comedy act, as Miranda Sings, at first in cabaret spaces and later in theatres in New York, London, and other cities in the US, UK, Australia, Europe, Canada and elsewhere.<ref>Blank, Matthew. [http://www.playbill.com/news/article/157833-PHOTO-CALL-Miranda-Sings-Christmas-Spectacular-With-Lauren-Kennedy-and-Frankie-Grande "'Miranda Sings Christmas Spectacular,' With [[Lauren Kennedy]] and Frankie Grande"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029204607/http://www.playbill.com/news/article/157833-PHOTO-CALL-Miranda-Sings-Christmas-Spectacular-With-Lauren-Kennedy-and-Frankie-Grande |date=October 29, 2013 }}, ''Playbill'', December 20, 2011; Sparks, Abbe. [http://triblocal.com/highland-park-highwood/community/stories/2010/11/mirfandas-infiltrate-highland-park-from-across-the-country-for-midwest-premiere-of-miranda-sings-live "Mirfandas Infiltrate Highland Park from across the country for Midwest Premiere of Miranda Sings Live!"], ''Chicago Tribune'' (Highland Park local), November 22, 2010</ref><ref name=world>[http://www.mirandasingsaustralia.com Miranda Sings Australia schedule] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110201232947/http://mirandasingsaustralia.com/ |date=February 1, 2011 }}, November 2009; ''Newcastle Herald'', November 26, 2009, p. 45; Michelin, Lana. [http://www.albertalocalnews.com/entertainment/How_not_to_sing_great_113485174.html "How (not) to sing great"]. ''Red Deer Advocate'', January 14, 2011; Bell, Matt. [http://standinginnovation.wordpress.com/2013/11/14/marketing-lessons-from-miranda-sings "Marketing Lessons from 'Miranda Sings'"], ''Standing (inn)ovation'', November 14, 2013</ref><ref>Dessau, Bruce. [http://www.beyondthejoke.co.uk/content/1058/news-uk-tour-dates-youtube-star-miranda-sings "UK Tour Dates for YouTube Star Miranda Sings"], ''Beyond the Joke'', September 4, 2014</ref> BroadwayWorld.com called Miranda "the hottest, freshest and oddest breakout star in the musical theatre/cabaret scene".<ref>[http://sanfrancisco.broadwayworld.com/article/Miranda_Sings_Returns_to_Rrazz_Room_October_9_20010101 "'Miranda Sings' Returns to Rrazz Room October 9".] BroadwayWorld.com, October 2, 2009, accessed July 23, 2010</ref>
In the live comedy acts, Miranda sings pop hits and some [[musical theatre]] songs in her signature off-key style.<ref name=Cadogan>Dessau, Bruce. [https://www.standard.co.uk/goingout/comedy/miranda-sings-cadogan-hall--comedy-review-9748389.html "Miranda Sings, Cadogan Hall â€“ comedy review"], ''[[London Evening Standard]]'', September 22, 2014</ref> At early performances, she gave "voice lessons" or "acting lessons" to [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] or [[West End Theatre|West End]] stars, such as [[Sutton Foster]] and [[Andrew Rannells]], to assembled casts of Broadway shows,<ref name=Velasco/> and to pop stars such as Ariana Grande,<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lp9vTNyt54k "Miranda Sings with Ariana Grande"], YouTube, June 21, 2011, accessed November 25, 2013; Ballinger met Grande in 2009, and the two have been friends since then. See Hasaka, Amanda. [http://www.teen.com/videos/2013/09/08/my-day-my-life-video-episodes/colleen-ballinger-video "My Day. My Life. With Colleen Ballinger!"], Teen.com, September 8, 2013, accessed June 12, 2014</ref> in which she was hypercritical of the stars' performances, telling them that they should leave show-business.<ref name=TheaterJones1/><ref>[http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/Photo_Flash_Miranda_Sings_Plays_Broadway_At_The_Birdland_1012_20091013 "Miranda Sings Plays 'Broadway At Birdland,' 10/12"]. Broadwayworld.com, October 13, 2009</ref><ref>Bullen, Bob. [http://chitheatreaddict.com/tag/miranda-sings "My very gay weekend: ''Valley of the Dolls'' at Music Box Theatre (with special guest Patty Duke) and Miranda Sings"], Chicago Theatre Addict, November 21, 2010, accessed April 17, 2014</ref> She reads hate mail that she has received; interacts with audience volunteers; uses projected presentations containing terrible spelling and includes a "magic trick" where she sings while appearing to be stabbed through the neck by a sword; the joke is that she sings better when the sword is inserted through her neck.<ref>Zwiebach, Elliot. [http://www.cabaretscenes.org/cabaret_reviews/2012/may12/miranda%20_sings_5-12.html "Miranda Sings"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029193619/http://www.cabaretscenes.org/cabaret_reviews/2012/may12/miranda%20_sings_5-12.html |date=October 29, 2013 }}, CabaretScenes.org, May 5, 2012, accessed June 6, 3013. See also [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pymRCjPdgy4 "Think of Me" â€“ "magic trick" video], YouTube, February 25, 2011</ref>
[[File:MirandaSanDiego.jpg|thumb|300px|Miranda, with Rachel Ballinger, on stage in 2014<ref>Ballinger's sister, Rachel Ballinger, from 2013 to 2015 was employed as Ballinger's onstage and offstage assistant.</ref>]] In her 2014 "Selp Helf" tour, she instructed her (mostly young, female) audience on how to get a boyfriend by being more Miranda-like,<ref name=BestBuy/><ref>O'Donoghue, Anna. [http://www.irishexaminer.com/breakingnews/entertainment/introducing-so-famous-voice-coach-model-magician--miranda-sings-643001.html "Introducing 'so famous' voice coach, model, magician - Miranda Sings"], ''[[Irish Examiner]]'', September 24, 2014</ref> "improvising [with volunteers] and creating punchlines on the spot. ... Ballinger, the genius behind Miranda, is so convincing in the role, you ... will likely forget that there is a normal person behind the red lips".<ref name=Cadogan/><ref>Sklar, Sam. [http://badgerherald.com/artsetc/2014/04/15/went-miranda-sings-show-became-mirfanda/#.U083XFdrtA4 "I went to a Miranda Sings show and became a 'Mirfanda'"], ''[[The Badger Herald]]'', April 15, 2014</ref><ref>Greenwood, Douglas. [http://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk/2014/08/edinburgh-festival-fringe-review-miranda-sings/ Edinburgh Festival Fringe Review â€“ Miranda Sings *****], ''The Edinburgh Reporter'', August 14, 2014</ref> One reviewer commented that the show "is no mere ... reproduction of her Internet channel. It is as theatrical as it is musical, comedic as it is inspirational."<ref name=Buffalo1/> Another concurred: "Miranda [is] hilarious, and I was struck on several occasions by what an accomplished creation the character is. ... Bridging both personas, the moment she transforms into Miranda, on-stage and mid-song, is an absolute joy â€“ I'd struggle to recall hearing an audience erupt to such an extent, and I couldn't help but join in."<ref name=Sherwin>Sherwin, Kevin. [http://www.broadwayworld.com/westend/article/BWW-Reviews-MIRANDA-SINGS-Leicester-Square-Theatre-September-9-2013-20130910 "Miranda Sings, Leicester Square Theatre, September 9, 2013"], BroadwayWorld, September 10, 2013</ref> Ballinger gave Miranda shows in 57 cities in 2014.<ref>Ballinger, Colleen. [http://instagram.com/p/vwPNEkMGUX List of cities for 2014], Instagram, November 23, 2014</ref> Her 2015 tours included a "Miranda 4 Precident" themed tour<ref>[http://concertfix.com/tours/miranda-sing "Miranda Sing Tour Dates 2015"], Concertfix.com, accessed August 11, 1025; and [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvCYoyFF6p4 "Miranda Sings Houston 2015 (pt2)"], YouTube, January 11, 2015</ref> and a "Summer Camp" themed tour.<ref>[http://newmediarockstars.com/2015/03/miranda-sings-tour-dates-the-youtube-star-takes-her-fans-to-summer-camp/ Miranda Sings Tour Dates: The YouTube Star Takes Her Fans to Summer Camp"], ''New Media Rockstars'', March 23, 2015, accessed August 11, 2015</ref> Also in 2015, Miranda was a headliner at the [[Just for Laughs]] festival in Toronto, Ontario, Canada,<ref name=JFL2015>Fraser, Garnet. [https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2015/09/27/miranda-sings-good-satire-better-role-model.html "Miranda Sings: Good satire, better role model"], ''[[Toronto Star]]'', September 27, 2015</ref><ref>Doherty, Brennan. [https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2015/09/28/your-morning-read-for-monday-september-28-2015-in-toronto.html "Your morning read for Monday, September 28, 2015 in Toronto"], ''[[Toronto Star]]'', September 28, 2015</ref> and released a film version of one of her stage shows on [[Vimeo]], titled ''Miranda Sings: Selp Helf''.<ref>Jarvey, Natalie. [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/youtube-channel-miranda-sings-debut-841031 "YouTube Channel Miranda Sings to Debut Comedy Special on Vimeo"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', November 17, 2015; and [https://vimeo.com/ondemand/mirandasingsselphelf ''Miranda Sings: Selp Helf''], Vimeo, November 16, 2015</ref>

[http://www.mlive.com/entertainment/grand-rapids/index.ssf/2016/01/youtube_comedian_tv_personalit.html "YouTube, TV personalities added to LaughFest 2016 lineup"], [[Booth Newspapers|MLive.com]], January 12, 2016</ref> a critic noted that the material "resonated with parents as well as the younger set."<ref>Rothwell, Jill. [http://thecollegiatelive.com/2016/03/miranda-sings-performed-laughfest-set-fountain-street-church-march-19 "Miranda Sings performed LaughFest set at Fountain Street Church on March 19"], ''The Collegiate'', Grand Rapids Community College, March 21, 2016</ref> Among other appearances, she performed as Miranda at the [[Kennedy Center]] in April 2016.<ref>Marks, Peter. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/theater_dance/coming-soon-to-the-kennedy-center-more-reasons-to-laugh/2015/11/17/9c64f0ce-8d3e-11e5-ae1f-af46b7df8483_story.html "Coming soon to the Kennedy Center: More reasons to laugh?"], ''The Washington Post'', November 18, 2015</ref> During the second half of 2016, she toured Miranda shows in the US, England, Ireland, Germany and Denmark, around her ''[[Haters Back Off]]'' production and promotion schedule.<ref>[http://teneightymagazine.com/2016/04/11/miranda-sings-announces-uk-tour-dates "Colleen [Ballinger] will be bringing her Miranda Sings tour back to the UK this August"], Teneightymagazine.com, April 11, 2016; Ballinger, Colleen. Your {{sic}} Welcome" and involved Miranda celebrating her own funeral.<ref name=Prospector/><ref>Ballinger, Colleen. ===Other Miranda appearances and activities=== In 2009, Ballinger released a Christmas [[Extended play|EP]] titled ''Christmas With Miranda Sings''.<ref>[http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/YouTube_Sensation_MIRANDA_SINGS_Releases_4_Holiday_Tunes_20091208 "YouTube Sensation Miranda Sings Releases 4 Holiday Tunes"], BroadwayWorld.com, December 8, 2009</ref> Miranda has been featured in radio, television and internet interviews.<ref name="Clevver">[http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/STAGE_TUBE_Miranda_Sings_Visits_Clevver_TV_20091104 "Stage Tube: 'Miranda Sings' Visits Clevver TV"], Broadway World, November 4, 2009</ref><ref>[http://andyandadrian.com/2009/11/19/singing-up-a-storm-with-miranda-sings/ "Singing up a Storm with Miranda Sings",] ''Andy & Adrian'' show, JOY 94.9FM radio in Melbourne, Australia, November 18, 2009; [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7m8fF0nh4is "CalTV Chats with Colleen Ballinger and Miranda Sings"], CalTV Berkeley, February 19, 2013; and [http://officialdjwm.wordpress.com/2014/07/20/miranda-sings-x-me-interview "Miranda Sings X Me [Interview]"], Will Manning Show, [[The Hits Radio]], July 20, 2014</ref> Ballinger has also appeared or hosted as Miranda at award shows<ref>Fox, Jena Tesse. [http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/THe_2010_Nightlife_Awards_20010101 "BWW Reviews: The 2010 Nightlife Awards"]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, broadwayworld.com, February 4, 2010</ref><ref>[http://www.cytsandiego.org/dca "CYT Directors' Choice Awards 2010"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725214331/http://www.cytsandiego.org/dca |date=July 25, 2011 }}, Christian Youth Theatre official website, accessed July 24, 2010</ref> and given benefit concerts<ref name=Lobero/><ref>[http://chicago.broadwayworld.com/viewcolumnpics.cfm?colid=173098&photoid=203682 "Photo Flash: Broadway Memories Fundraiser"]. BroadwayWorld.com, accessed January 21, 2011</ref> and workshops.<ref name=CCRI/> Miranda sings two tracks in character on Passey's album ''Self Taught, Still Learning''.<ref name=Browne/> In 2012, the character appeared in a comedy film, ''[[Varla Jean Merman|Varla Jean]] and the Mushroomheads'',<ref>[http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/varla_jean_and_the_mushroomheads_2012 "''Varla Jean and the Mushroomheads'' (2012)"], RottenTomatoes.com, accessed December 13, 2013</ref> and in an episode of the television show ''[[Victorious]]'', titled "Tori Goes Platinum", on the [[Nickelodeon]] channel.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20130707032824/http://www.nickutopia.com/2012/05/18/miranda-sings-talks-about-guest-starring-on-victorious "Miranda Sings Talks About Guest Starring on ''Victorious''"], Nickutopia.com, May 18, 2012, copy from Wayback machine accessed June 12, 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.theslap.com/galleries/92/slideshow#http://staticassets.www.theslap.com/images/5811922/large.jpg Miranda Sings on ''Victorious''], ''The Slap'', May 18, 2012; and [http://weheartit.com/entry/group/25626372 "Miranda Sings on 'Tori Goes Platinum'"], May 2012, accessed June 12, 2014</ref> Miranda appeared in the first episode of ''Dance Chat'', an Australian web show, in 2013.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y0OzjoGy774#t=372 "''Dance Chat'' Episode #1 with Miranda Sings, Sam Wasson & Marko Panzic"], YouTube, November 21, 2013</ref> She also appeared in a 2014 back-to-school video for [[Old Navy]].<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RybcC2ef2zg "Unlimited"], Old Navy, YouTube, September 30, 2014, accessed February 19, 2016</ref>
Ballinger guest-starred as Miranda Sings in the season 5 episode, "Happy Thanksgiving Miranda", of ''[[Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee]]'' with [[Jerry Seinfeld]], in November 2014.<ref>[http://www.crackle.com/c/comedians-in-cars-getting-coffee "Jerry's Next Guest is Miranda Sings": trailer], ''Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee'', Crackle, November 24, 2014</ref> Seinfeld called Miranda "a very well-developed character ... just as funny to me as ... to my daughter, who is 13. ... [The episode is] one of the best shows of ''Comedians in Cars'' weâ€™ve ever done."<ref>Hyman, Dan. [http://www.vulture.com/2014/11/jerry-seinfeld-interview-youtube-star-miranda.html "Jerry Seinfeld Talks to YouTube Star Colleen Ballinger About Why the Internet Is Better Than TV"], Vulture, ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'', November 27, 2014</ref> [[Mediaite]] agreed, writing: "In its fifth season, Jerry Seinfeld's web series continued to be one of the most enjoyable weekly events on the internet. His experience with YouTube star Miranda Sings, which carried its way onto the ''Tonight Show'', was a particular highlight."<ref>Wilstein, Matt. [http://www.mediaite.com/tv/the-10-best-tv-shows-that-arent-really-tv-of-2014/#4 "The 10 Best TV Shows of 2014 That Aren't ''Really'' TV"], Mediaite.com, December 19, 2014</ref> An [[Jarret Myer#Uproxx|Uproxx]] review compared Ballinger to [[Andy Kaufman]].<ref>Roberts, Andrew. [http://uproxx.com/tv/2014/12/jerry-seinfeld-takes-a-torturous-ride-with-youtubes-miranda-sings-and-finds-out-how-to-be-famous "Jerry Seinfeld Takes a Torturous Ride with YouTubeâ€™s Miranda Sings and Finds Out How to Be Famous"], Uproxx, December 1, 2014</ref> In December 2014, Ballinger appeared as Miranda on ''[[The Tonight Show]]'' playing ''[[Pictionary]]'' with [[Jimmy Fallon]], [[Martin Short]] and Jerry Seinfeld.<ref>[http://www.nbc.com/the-tonight-show/segments/77811 "Pictionary with Martin Short, Jerry Seinfeld and Miranda Sings"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150217045407/http://www.nbc.com/the-tonight-show/segments/77811 |date=February 17, 2015 }}, ''[[The Tonight Show]]'', [[NBC]], December 1, 2014</ref> ''[[Us Weekly]]'' called the segment "the most hilarious game night ever",<ref>Boardman, Madeline. [http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/martin-short-jerry-seinfeld-play-pictionary-with-jimmy-fallon-watch-2014212 "Martin Short, Jerry Seinfeld Play Hilarious Game of Pictionary With Jimmy Fallon"], ''Us Weekly'', December 2, 2014</ref> ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' called it "riveting",<ref>Highfill, Samantha. [http://popwatch.ew.com/2014/12/02/martin-short-jerry-seinfeld-pictionary-the-tonight-show "Martin Short, Jerry Seinfeld, and Miranda Sings play Pictionary on 'Fallon'"], ''Entertainment Weekly'', December 2, 2014</ref> and ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine wrote: "It's the most wonderful trainwrecked game of ''Pictionary'' you'll see this holiday season".<ref>[http://www.people.com/article/martin-short-jerry-seinfeld-pictionary-jimmy-fallon-tonight-show?xid=socialflow_facebook_peoplemag "Watch Martin Short and Jerry Seinfeld Play Holiday Pictionary on The Tonight Show"], ''People'' magazine, December 2, 1014</ref>
In 2015, Ballinger appeared as Miranda on ''[[The Grace Helbig Show]]'', together with [[Jim Parsons]],<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TYJWJ4tmgG8 "Jim Parsons and Miranda Sings Join Grace for 'Whelp'!"], E! Entertainment, April 17, 2015</ref> and she released a book, ''[[Selp-Helf]]'', published by [[Simon & Schuster]], which calls it a "decidedly unhelpful, candid, hilarious 'how-to' guide". Written in Miranda's voice by Ballinger and her brother Christopher Ballinger,<ref>Seabaugh, Julie. [http://www.laweekly.com/arts/the-woman-behind-miranda-one-of-the-strangest-and-most-beloved-characters-on-youtube-5827099 "The Woman Behind Miranda, One of the Strangest and Most Beloved Characters on YouTube"], ''[[LA Weekly]]'', July 23, 2015, accessed April 8, 2018</ref> it is presented in mock-scrapbook format, with silly advice, photos and comically bad artwork.<ref>[http://www.broadwayworld.com/article/STAGE-TUBE-Miranda-Sings-Quits-Youtube-Announces-Book-Plans-20150225 "Stage Tube: Miranda Sings Quits Youtube; Announces Book Plans!"], BroadwayWorld.com, February 25, 2015; Kawecki, Jenny. [http://www.barnesandnoble.com/blog/selp-helf-is-the-hilarious-debut-book-from-youtube-star-miranda-sings "What You Need to Know Before You Read Selp-Helf, the Debut Book from YouTube Star Miranda Sings"], Barnes & Noble, July 20, 2015</ref> The book debuted at No. 1 on the ''[[Publishers Weekly]]'' Hardcover Non-Fiction best sellers list<ref name=PublishersWeekly>[http://bigstory.ap.org/article/a1572ad53f574949a1720c693ffbaf2c/publishers-weekly-best-sellers "''Publishers Weekly'' Best-Sellers"], Associated Press, July 30, 2015</ref> and ''The New York Times'' Best Seller list for Advice, How-To & Miscellaneous.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2015-08-09/advice-how-to-and-miscellaneous/list.html "Best Sellers: Advice, How-To & Miscellaneous"], ''The New York Times'', August 9, 2015 (sales for the week ending July 25, 2015)</ref> It remained on the ''Times''{{'}} Best Seller list for Advice & Misc. for 11 weeks<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2015-10-18/advice-how-to-and-miscellaneous/list.html "Advice, How-To & Miscellaneous"], ''The New York Times'', October 18, 2015 (sales for the week ending October 3, 2015)</ref> and was on their monthly Best Seller list for "Humor" for eleven months.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/2016/05/01/humor "Best Sellers: Humor"], ''The New York Times'', May 2016</ref> She released a second book, ''My Diarrhe'', in 2018, in the form of a [[News leak|leaked]] diary.<ref>Weiss, Geoff. [https://www.tubefilter.com/2018/02/16/simon-schuster-leaks-miranda-sings-my-diarrhe "Simon & Schuster to Leak Miranda Sings' Dirty Secrets In Second Book, ''My Diarrhe''"], TubeFilter.com, February 16, 2018; and Sings, Miranda. [https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/38593516-my-diarrhe "My Diarrhe"], Goodreads.com, accessed July 17, 2018</ref> It debuted at No. 8 on ''The New York Times'' Best Seller list for Advice, How-To & Miscellaneous.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/advice-how-to-and-miscellaneous/?action=click&contentCollection=Books&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2Fbooks%2Fbest-sellers%2F&region=Footer&module=WeeklyListsIndex&version=Nonfiction&pgtype=Reference "Advice, How-To & Miscellaneous"], ''The New York Times'', accessed July 23, 2018</ref> Ballinger appeared on ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]'' in July 2018 to promote the book.<ref>Colbert, Stephen. [https://www.cbs.com/shows/the-late-show-with-stephen-colbert/video/DKrLu_ouhsoTCWHli0SUv9vUVUF2bdrA/miranda-sings-gives-birth-on-the-stephen-colbert-show-to-a-hairy-squash "Miranda Sings Gives Birth on the Stephen Colbert Show to a Hairy Squash S3 E172"], ''[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]'', July 16, 2018</ref>
Ballinger appeared as a guest star, as Miranda, on the 2016 [[YouTube Red]] series ''Prank Academy''.<ref>[http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwtv/article/Sneak-Peek-YouTube-Red-to-Debuts-Two-New-Original-Series-330-20160328# "Sneak Peek â€“ YouTube Red to Debuts Two New Original Series, 3/30"], BroadwayWorld.com, March 28, 2016; PrankvsPrank. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Z8vI1MtOX4 "Speed Dating Prank!!! ft. Miranda Sings"], Prank Academy, April 20, 2016</ref> She conceived, co-wrote, co-produced and starred as Miranda in the [[Netflix]] series, ''[[Haters Back Off]]''. The series centered around Miranda's odd family life and her road to fame as a YouTuber.<ref name=Snetiker>Snetiker, Marc. [http://www.ew.com/article/2016/06/24/miranda-sings-haters-back-off-netflix-premiere "Miranda Sings series Haters Back Off sets Netflix premiere date"], ''Entertainment Weekly'', June 24, 2016</ref><ref>Spangler, Todd. [https://variety.com/2016/digital/news/miranda-sings-haters-back-off-first-look-netflix-1201850139 "Miranda Sings in ''Haters Back Off'': First Look at Netflix Oddball Family Sitcom"], ''Variety'', September 1, 2016</ref> Ballinger was featured as Miranda in a cover article in ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' about the show in June 2016.<ref name=Spangler2016/> The series ran for two seasons in 2016<ref name=Snetiker/> and 2017.<ref>Masters, Cayla. [https://hiddenremote.com/2017/09/11/haters-back-off-season-two-premiere-date-announced "''Haters Back Off'' season two premiere date announced"], HiddenRemote.com, September 11, 2017; and Spangler, Todd. [https://variety.com/2017/digital/news/colleen-ballinger-miranda-sings-haters-back-off-netflix-sexual-harassment-1202598984 "Colleen Ballinger on Miranda Sings' Evolution, Working With Netflix and Sexual Harassment in the Industry"], ''Variety'', October 25, 2017</ref> Ballinger appeared on ''The Tonight Show''<ref>Romano, Nick. [http://www.ew.com/article/2016/10/15/tonight-show-colleen-ballinger-miranda-sings "Colleen Ballinger becomes Miranda Sings for Jimmy Fallon interview"], ''Entertainment Weekly'', October 15, 2016</ref> twice,<ref name=Tonight2>[https://www.broadwayworld.com/article/VIDEO-Colleen-Ballinger-Talks-Season-2-of-Netflixs-HATERS-BACK-OFF-20171024 "Video: Colleen Ballinger Talks Season 2 of Netflix's ''Haters Back Off''"], BroadwayWorld, October 24, 2017</ref> ''[[Chelsea (TV series)|Chelsea]]'',<ref>Handler, Chelsea. [https://www.netflix.com/watch/80104606?trackId=13752289&tctx=0%2C0%2C6cde49bf-acc8-4130-84a7-6ee61ebaad03-34232449 "''Please Take My Knickers Off'', Season 1, Episode 75"], ''[[Chelsea (TV series)|Chelsea]]'', November 4, 2016 {{subscription}}</ref> ''Live with Kelly and Ryan'' three times,<ref name=KandR>[http://people.com/tv/morning-show-halloween-costumes/terrific-threesome "Terrific Threesome"], ''People'', October 31, 2017; [http://people.com/tv/morning-show-halloween-costumes/make-me-over "Make Me Over"], ''People'', October 31, 2017; [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oN6wBs0udyM "Live with Kelly and Ryan (August 7, 2017) Billy Eichner, Colleen Ballinger, Joey Graceffa Interview"], YouTube, Disney ABC Home Entertainment and Television, August 7, 2017; and [https://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwtv/article/LIVE-WITH-KELLY-AND-RYAN-to-Take-Annual-Halloween-Extravaganza-to-New-Heights-20171019 "''Live with Kelly and Ryan'' to Take Annual Halloween Extravaganza to New Heights!"], BroadwayWorld.com, October 19, 2017; [http://kellyandryan.com/guide/october-23-2017 "Episode Guide: The Mummy Game!"], ''Live with Kelly and Ryan'', October 23, 2017; and [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=baCaSV1jVHU "America Ferrera and Colleen Ballinger Interview on Live with Kelly and Ryan (January 2, 2018)"], YouTube, ''Live with Kelly 2017'', January 2, 2018</ref> and ''[[Total Request Live]]'' to promote it.<ref>Gore, Sydney. [http://trl.mtv.com/news/3044607/miranda-sings-trl-appearance "Miranda Sings' Haters Will Definitely Back Off After Watching This"], MTV, October 30, 2017</ref> It was not picked up for a third season.<ref>Lee, Josh. [http://www.wetheunicorns.com/news/haters-back-off-trailer-netflix "Netflix Just Cancelled Haters Back Off and Colleen Ballinger Is 'Heartbroken'"], WeTheUnicorns.com, December 5, 2017</ref>
==Philanthropy== Since 2015, Ballinger has conducted an annual fundraiser to benefit childhood cancer, beginning on her birthday, November 21.<ref>Mendez, Michele. [http://celebmix.com/colleen-ballinger-raise-money-childhood-cancer "Colleen Ballinger to Raise Money for Childhood Cancer"], Celebmix.com, November 22, 2016</ref> Using her YouTube channel and GoFundMe, she gives away personal items and Miranda merchandise and props, and draft scripts from ''Haters Back Off''. In 2015, Ballinger donated all of the funds raised to [[St. Jude Childrenâ€™s Research Hospital]], while in 2016, she donated to individual families struggling with the costs and burdens of their children's cancer treatments.<ref>Weiss, Geoff. [http://www.tubefilter.com/2016/11/28/colleen-ballinger-combat-childhood-cancer "Colleen Ballinger Has Raised $40,000 (and Counting) to Combat Childhood Cancer"], Tubefilter.com, November 28, 2016; and [http://familyreach.org/blog/colleen-ballinger-cancer-advocate "Colleen Ballinger: Comedian, actress, singer and cancer advocate"], FamilyReach.org, April 6, 2017</ref>
==Reception== Ballinger's YouTube videos have received a total of more than 3 billion views.<ref name=Channels/> In 2015, Miranda was ranked the 7th "most popular YouTube personality", by ''[[Daily American]]'',<ref name=DailyAmerican>Elinzano, Maureen. [http://www.dailyamerican.com/entertainment/the-most-popular-youtube-personalities/article_b094180e-9a5e-5df3-aafe-0d1be2e9b620.html "The 7 most popular YouTube personalities"], ''[[Daily American]]'', January 22, 2015</ref> and one of the "Top 25 Digital Stars", by ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]''.<ref name=Jarvey1>Jarvey, Natalie and Benjamin Svetkey. [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/person/colleen-ballinger "THR's Top 25 Digital Stars"] and [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/thrs-top-25-digital-stars-808941 "Top 25 Digital Stars Revealed"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', July 16, 2015</ref> The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' wrote of her videos, "this footage is a major hoot".<ref name=Ng/> [[Perez Hilton]] praised Miranda's parody of [[Sia (musician)|Sia's]] song "[[Chandelier (song)|Chandelier]]" as "the crowning achievement of music video parodies ... utterly fantastic. ... [Ballinger] really has superb comedic timing."<ref>Hilton, Perez. [http://perezhilton.com/perezitos/2014-08-12-miranda-sings-covers-sia-chandelier-parody#.U_SmwNCa_Bs This Chandelier Spoof Is the Crowning Achievement of Music Video Parodies!"], PerezHilton.com, August 12, 2014</ref> Initially, Miranda Sings enjoyed widespread popularity among musical theatre fans.<ref name=Liberty/><ref name=Videoink/><ref name=Ng/> Later, her fan base expanded particularly among teenagers.<ref name=Keihm/><ref name=world/><ref name=Stage>Hemley, Matthew. [http://www.thestage.co.uk/columns/hemley-on-tv/2013/09/case-musical-theatre-proms "At last, a Miranda whoâ€™s funny..."], ''[[The Stage]]'', September 2013</ref> ''[[TV Guide]]'' commented: "Ironically, the character ... was created to satirize the very type of YouTube fame she's managed to cultivate."<ref>[http://www.tvguide.com/PhotoGallery/Favorite-YouTube-Stars-1084376/1084388 "Our Favorite YouTube Stars"], ''TV Guide'', accessed July 19, 2014</ref>
''The Times'' of London commented that although Ballinger's videos have gained her character notice, it "is not online but on stage that Miranda truly comes to ghastly life."<ref name=times/> A reviewer from the ''[[Irish Independent]]'' wrote: "There is an endearing sweetness to her performance. ... This bizarre and bonkers show is somehow strangely compelling".<ref>Sweeney, Eamon. [http://www.independent.ie/entertainment/the-rise-of-the-youtube-celebrity-is-a-relatively-new-phenomenon-no-one-could-have-predicted-the-runaway-success-of-the-site-when-it-was-launched-in-february-2005-but-less-than-a-decade-later-and-it-has-completely-revolutionised-the-entertainment-industry-30610811.html "Comedy Miranda Sings: Vicar St, Dublin"], ''Irish Independent'', September 25, 2014</ref> A 2013 reviewer concurred: "[O]nly a truly talented performer could make the Miranda character believable, let alone as endearing as she ends up being."<ref name=Peen/><ref>Allen, Matthew. [http://atlanta.broadwayworld.com/article/BWW-Preview-Miranda-Sings-Brings-Her-Uniquely-Entertaining-Must-See-Show-to-Actors-Express-20130620# "Miranda Sings Brings Her Bizarrely Wonderful, Must-See Show to Actor's Express"], Atlanta.broadwayworld.com, June 20, 2013</ref> AussieTheatre.com stated that Ballinger "creates the most successful parody of the world of YouTube ... she has created an international cult following".<ref>Allen, David. [http://aussietheatre.com.au/news/miranda-sings-coming-australia-haters-back "Miranda Sings is coming to Australia â€“ haters, back off!"], AussieTheatre.com, November 5, 2013</ref> As the popularity of the character increased, Ballinger was able to book longer runs of her live Miranda act, at larger and larger venues,<ref name=Leicester2013>Sherwin, Kevin. [http://www.broadwayworld.com/westend/article/BWW-Reviews-MIRANDA-SINGS-Leicester-Square-Theatre-September-9-2013-20130910 "Miranda Sings, Leicester Square Theatre, September 9, 2013"], BroadwayWorld, September 10, 2013; Moore, James. [http://sosogay.co.uk/2013/review-miranda-sings-leicester-square-theatre "Review: Miranda Sings (Leicester Square Theatre)"], ''So So Gay'', September 10, 2013; Sims, Samuel. [http://www.ayoungertheatre.com/tag/colleen-ballinger "Review: Miranda Sings"], ''A Younger Theatre'', September 10, 2013</ref><ref name=Innovation>Bell, Matt. [http://standinginnovation.wordpress.com/2013/11/14/marketing-lessons-from-miranda-sings "Marketing Lessons from 'Miranda Sings'"], ''Standing (inn)ovation'', November 14, 2013</ref> including the [[Best Buy Theater]] in New York City<ref name=BestBuy>[http://www.freenewspos.com/english/video/Best%20Buy/A8SRs6cloT8 "Miranda Sings - Best Buy Theater Marquee â€“ January 11, 2014"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20140112185415/http://www.freenewspos.com/english/video/Best%20Buy/A8SRs6cloT8 |date=January 12, 2014 }}, FreeNewsPos.com, January 12, 2014</ref> and, among many others, London's [[Cadogan Hall]].<ref name=Cadogan/><ref>Patel, Sahil. [http://www.thevideoink.com/news/miranda-sings-joins-big-frame/#.VDVwVxr6cWc "Miranda Sings Joins Big Frame"], ''The videoink'', August 13, 2013, accessed October 8, 2014</ref>
Ballinger's videos as herself have also gained attention: in 2015, her video "Reading Mean Comments" was praised by ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]'' as "hilarious and pretty poignant".<ref>Rose, Rebecca. [http://www.cosmopolitan.com/lifestyle/news/a44065/youtuber-shuts-down-venomous-trolls-with-hilarious-song-about-their-bad-spelling "YouTuber Shuts Down Trolls With Hilarious Song About Their Bad Spelling"], ''Cosmopolitan'', July 29, 2015. [http://www.look.co.uk/Miranda%20sings%20actress%20hits%20back%20at%20haters "Miranda Sings: The Actress Behind the YouTube Sensation Hits Back at Haters"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150803012944/http://www.look.co.uk/Miranda%20sings%20actress%20hits%20back%20at%20haters |date=August 3, 2015 }}, ''[[Look (UK magazine)|Look]]'' magazine, July 30, 2015; and Cowan, Samantha. [http://www.backstage.com/news/5th-annual-streamy-awards-winners-announced "5th Annual Streamy Awards Winners Announced"], ''Back Stage'', September 18, 2015; Kelley, Seth. [https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/snapperhero-epic-rap-battles-of-history-lead-2015-streamy-award-nominations-1201568512 "â€˜SnapperHero,â€™ â€˜Epic Rap Battles of Historyâ€™ Lead 2015 Streamy Award Nominations"], ''Variety'', August 12, 2015; and Jarvey, Natalie. [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/tyler-oakley-jenna-marbles-streamys-820071 "Tyler Oakley, Jenna Marbles Among Streamys Audience Choice Nominees"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', September 3, 2015</ref> Miranda was nominated for a 2015 [[42nd People's Choice Awards|People's Choice Award]],<ref name=Peoples>[http://blog.peopleschoice.com/2015/11/03/peoples-choice-awards-2016-nominees "People's Choice Awards 2016: Full List of Nominees"], People'sChoice.com, November 3, 2015</ref> a [[8th Shorty Awards|2016 Shorty Award]]<ref name=Shorty2016>Lee, Ashley. [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/shorty-awards-2016-nominees-adele-857025 "Shorty Awards Nominees Include Adele, Kevin Hart, Amy Schumer"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', January 19, 2016</ref> and two 2016 [[Streamy Awards]].<ref name=Streamy2016>Robinson, Will. [http://www.ew.com/article/2016/10/04/streamy-awards-2016-winners-list "Streamy Awards 2016: Full winners list"], ''Entertainment Weekly'', October 4, 2016</ref> Ballinger was ranked No. 5 on ''Forbes'' magazine's 2017 list of top entertainment influencers.<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/profile/miranda-sings/?list=top-influencers-entertainment "#5: Miranda Sings"], ''Forbes'', June 24, 2017</ref> She has been ranked No. 1 on several weekly Top Comedians Social Media Rankings by ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]''.<ref>Rutherford, Kevin. [https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/colleen-ballinger-leads-top-comedians-social-media-ranking-first-time-1125358 "Colleen Ballinger Leads Top Comedians Social Media Ranking for the First Time"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', July 7, 2018; and Rutherford, Kevin. [https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/colleen-ballinger-spends-fourth-week-at-no-1-top-comedians-social-media-ranking-1130369 "Colleen Ballinger Spends Fourth Week at No. 1 on Top Comedians Social Media Ranking"], ''The Hollywood Reporter'', July 28, 2018</ref>
